wiki.summary: On “Ric Flair Drip,” Offset flaunts his intimidating and towering wealth. This song is named after 2-time WWE Hall of Famer and 16-World Champion Ric Flair. Offset pays his respects, seeing as he often uses Ric Flair’s trademark shout “Whoo!” as an ad-lib; most notably in “Bad and Boujee”. The two also share a similarly lavish and wild lifestyle. Since dropping the song, it appears the two have also developed a friendship. They filmed the official music video together Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On “Ric Flair Drip,” Offset flaunts his intimidating and towering wealth. This song is named after 2-time WWE Hall of Famer and 16-World Champion Ric Flair. Offset pays his respects, seeing as he often uses Ric Flair’s trademark shout “Whoo!” as an ad-lib; most notably in “Bad and Boujee”. The two also share a similarly lavish and wild lifestyle. Since dropping the song, it appears the two have also developed a friendship. They filmed the official music video together, and Offset later wished Ric a happy Birthday via an Instagram post. On April 18, two-time WWE Hall of Famer Ric Flair and Migos member Offset performed the popular track together on Jimmy Fallon’s The Tonight Show. “Ric Flair Drip” was certified 6x platinum by the RIAA on November 24, 2020. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
